translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Paduma and Kesara
The Elder Who Gave a Monastery🔽“I planted a monastery
for the Fortunate One Siddhattha,
under trees with continuous shade,
while birds were chirping.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the receiver of offerings,
and I dedicated the monastery
to the world’s chief, the bull of a man.
With a joyful and uplifted mind,
I gave flowers and fruits,
and then, with faith arisen,
I dedicated that grove.🔽With a serene mind
